item.title: Game | Macau Sands profit fell 13% in the second quarter
item.description:
The company responsible for Casinos Venetian, Parisian and Londoner closed the second quarter with profits of $ 214 million. Despite the reduction in the face of last year, those responsible for the group underline the commitment to invest in the
Casinos operator in Macau Sands China announced yesterday's $ 214 million profits in the second quarter, a 13 percent drop over the same period of 2024. Sands China had already registered a 32 percent homologous drop in the first trimester profit. This after ending 2024 with profits of $ 1.05 billion, an increase of 50.9 percent. On the contrary, the revenues of the company's five casinos in Macau rose 2.5 percent between April and June, to $ 1.8 billion. With revenues to rise, Sands China registered operational profits of $ 566 million in the second quarter of 2025, a rise of 0.9 percent in annual terms. Robert Goldstein, the president of the Sands China mother company, the American Las Vegas Sands (LVS), pointed to the goal for the casinos in Macao operational profits between 600 and 650 million dollars per quarter. According to a statement from Sands China, Goldstein also said in an investor teleconference that the annual goal, by 2027, is operational profits of between $ 2.6 and $ 2.7 billion. According to official data, the game industry in Macau registered total revenues of 61.1 billion patacas between April and June, 8.3 percent than in the same period as 2024. Long commitment Still, Goldstein recalled that Sands China has a "commitment to a decade of making investments that increase the Macao Business and Leisure Appeal and support its development as a world tourism center." The company is one of six casino dealers who operate in the territory and whose concession contract, valid for ten years, came into force on January 1, 2023. At the time, the six operators pledged to invest “over 100 billion patacas” in unnataged elements. Sands announced “an iconic winter garden” with 50 thousand square meters. "We are still enthusiastic about our opportunities to achieve leading industry growth in both Macao and Singapore in the coming years," Goldstein noted. Sands China made total investments of $ 286 million between April and June, including $ 138 million in Macao. Most of the money was to reshape the integrated venture Hotel-Casino Londoner Macao, a partnership with former British footballer David Beckham. The remodeling was ready in mid -April, in time for the so -called 'golden week' of May 1, a period of holidays in mainland China and a high time for tourism in Macao.

item.title: Borders | Macau behind HK in the ranking of best passports
item.description:
Macao occupies the 31st position worldwide on the list of the most powerful passports, behind Hong Kong, which is in 17th position and has more destinations without visa. Portugal occupies 4th place and China the 60th in the ranking led by Singapore
Henley & Partners' latest passport rate, entitled “Henley Passport Index” places Macau in 31st place, right behind 17th Hong Kong's detained position. The two special administrative regions are, however, in better positions compared to China, which occupy the 60th place. The Macao passport allows you to travel without visa to 144 destinations, while for Hong Kong the list of countries traveling without a visa is larger, with 169. In the case of China, there are only 83 countries where national citizens can travel without visa. In a press release on the report's results, Henley & Partners points out that China leads, along with the United Arab Emirates (EAU), a "change in passport power." The consultant highlights "a general global change towards more openness, greater mobility and increased strength of passports", given that, in the last decade, "more than 80 passports have risen at least 10 positions". In addition, "the average global number of destinations to which travelers can access without visa almost doubled from 58 in 2006 to 109 by 2025". In the case of China, the climb was 34 positions, “from 94th to 60th position since 2015-which is particularly impressive, considering that, unlike other countries that have risen in the ranking, China has not yet obtained access without visa to the Schengen space of Europe,” he stands out in the statement. The passport rate shows how “China's rise has been assisted by its significant movement towards greater opening”, given that the country “granted access without visa to more than a dozen new passports since January, raising its total opening score to 75 nations, a remarkable change considering that it allowed entry less than 20 countries for only five years”. Global analysis Henley & Partner's passport rate classifies 199 countries and regions according to the number of nationalities to which allow entry without prior visa. The data that are referenced to this ranking are from the International Air Transport Association (IATA). Still with regard to China's positioning, they refer to “the remarkable additions to China's visa exemption list this year, with nations such as Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman and Saudi Arabia. This means, for analysts, that "citizens of all Gulf Cooperation Council can travel to China without prior visa - as well as from several South American countries, including Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Peru and Uruguay." "The concession of uninstated access by China to several European countries in the last two years has also contributed to the dominance of European passports at the top of Henley Passport Power Index, which measures the percentage of GDP [Gross Domestic Product] that each passport provides its holders without visa," is mentioned. Worldwide, "Asian nations dominate the ranking of passport power," with the US and the United Kingdom to continue "declining." Singapore "holds the most powerful passport title in the world, with visaless access to 193 destinations from 227 worldwide." Asian countries continue to lead the race for global mobility, with Japan and South Korea to share second place, each granting its citizens access to 190 no visa destinations.

item.title: Real Estate | Chan Iek Lap calls for seal tax reduction
item.description:
The deputy thinks that the government must follow the examples of Hong Kong and the interior of China and reduce the value of the seal tax on home purchase. Moreover, it argues that the tax should not be paid when the business is aborted
Deputy Chan Iek Lap advocates the reduction of the seal tax on real estate transactions. The subject is addressed through written interpeação, released on the Legislative Assembly portal. In the document, the deputy asks if there is an opening of the executive to lower the value of the tax seal on real estate transactions, as indicated in Hong Kong and in the interior of China: “Given the tendency to change taxes on real estate transactions in neighboring regions, and since the cities in the interior of China and also Hong Kong also indicated that the future goes through tax adjustments to reduce the charges on transactions. Will real estate agents, will the government consider the possibility of reducing tax costs for the benefit of the public? ”Asks the legislator. Currently, the seal tax on costly real estate transmissions ranges from 1 percent in transmissions with a value up to 2 million patacas, rises to 2 percent when the value of the business exceeds 2 million patacas and reaches 4 million patacas. The highest tax is 3 percent, when the value of the transfer of the property exceeds 4 million patacas. If the transmission has no costs for the parties, the tax is 5 percent. In the same vein, Chan wants to know if the executive has plans to reduce bureaucratic costs associated with real estate transactions. Since the COVID-19 pandemic and the campaign against the prosecutors of the game that the local real estate market has gone into crisis, with successive breaks of real estate and the reduction of transactions. The situation finds parallel in the interior, where the real estate market also suffered a sharp decrease. As a way of reaction to the real estate crisis, the government of Ho IAT SENG launched in 2024 a package of measures that aimed to lower taxation that focuses on residents and non-residents. Voluntary interruption In questioning, Chan Iek Lap argues that the executive must change the seal tax collection regime in cases where real estate transactions are aborted. Currently, real estate purchase and sale contracts are subject to tax payment, even if there is no transmission of the property's property right, because the parties choose to give up the business. There are also situations where the tax is paid, even later the parties have conditions that make it impossible to transmit the property. For Chan Iek Lap the tax payment in these situations is “extremely irrational”. Even in cases where it is possible to recover the amount of paid amount, when there was no transmission of the property, the deputy complains that it is necessary to face a case in the courts, and pay the costs that the action implies. In view of this scenario, the deputy intends that the government alter the legislation so that the tax is only due when the parties effectively transmit the property. At the same time, it asks for the return to the past, when 0.5 percent of the tax was paid at the time of the transaction and the rest at the time of signature of the Notarial Certificate of Purchase and Selling.

item.title: Tourism | International visitors increase 14.8%
item.description: Data from the Statistics and Census Services Directorate (DSEC) show that in the first half of this year the number of international visitors in Macau was 1,341,674, which represents an increase of 14.8 percent in annual terms. Highlight for the 16.8 percent increase in the number of visitor entries of the Philippines and 13.8 percent of Indonesia. Regarding southern Asia, the number of visitor entries from India (58,309) registered a homologous growth of 6.2 percent, while the number of visitors from the Republic of Korea (282,151) and that of Japan (76,435) also increased 21.7 and 23.5 percent, respectively, compared to the first half of 2024. In the first half of this year the number of visitors in Macao totaled 19,218,540, plus 14.9 percent in annual terms. It is emphasized that the number of tour entries (11,182,913) and tourists (8,035,627) increased 25.8 and 2.6 percent, respectively, in annual terms. In the first semester the number of visitors in the interior of China was set on 13,767,810, plus 19.3 percent in annual terms, highlighting the 24.6 percent increase in the number of entries with individual visas. From the great bay arrived 7,016,216 people in six months, plus 25.7 percent compared to the first half of 2024, thanks to the number of entries from visitors from Zhuhai grew 57 percent.

item.title: AL | Ron Lam worried about lack of various voices
item.description:
Still dealing with the impact of exclusion from elections, Deputy Ron Lam considers that at this stage the most important thing is to ensure that among the future 14 deputies directly elected someone represents the opinions of the population in the hemiciclo
At a time when he is still a deputy, although prevented from participating in the next elections by political decision of the State Security Defense Commission, Ron Lam was concerned with lack of voices in the Legislative Assembly (AL) representing the population. The position was taken during the latest episode of the Macao Synergy Association podcast, which served as a base of support for the deputy's list. According to Lam, with its departure there is a risk of all voices within the hemiciclo if they always limit the government, without questioning the projects presented. The legislator fears as soon as deputies, due to the fear of questioning, merely agree with almost everything the government presents and do not contribute to the development of the territory, nor to take action that meet the wishes of the population. Ron Lam justified a new environment in the Legislative Assembly, due to the way he was viewed by the system as a radical, when he was previously seen as a moderate. "Looking at my speeches and comparing the past, people said they were soft and in vain. But now they say they are radical," Lam said. "But to be honest, if even these criticisms are accepted, I wouldn't be able to continue to work either," he added. The deputy then focused on his replacement: "Now the most important question is to see who will be with the place of Ron Lam u tou in the Legislative Assembly. Even though Ron Lam u tou macau synergy association are represented, this is not the most important. The important thing is that some of the six lists and the 14 elected deputies play the same role," he said. Almost everything in favor Throughout the podcast, Ron Lam did not escape the process of his exclusion, which he once again said he could not understand. Despite the criticism and doubts raised in the Plenary of AL, the still deputy said he voted for almost 95 percent of occasions in favor of the government. And when he voted against, Ron Lam justified that the proposals had very evident problems, or that the government did not want to explain the reasons for legislative options, as it said that it had happened in the vote of the new intermediate housing law and the law of the game forcing the end of satellite casinos. Ron Lam also recalled that although his criticism was aimed at some rulers, as he was the only one who dared to question, that some of his views were adopted and resulted in savings for the public purse: "I remember once, one ruler told me," Only you have problems, the other deputies do not have. " “Also on a more important and recent subject, as with housing buildings for specialist doctors, I was the only one against the project. At that time our list was accused of being the opposition. Now the government has abandoned the project and managed to save 500 million patacas, ”he added. Output Ron Lam also showed in a showcase and proudly the oath of defense of the basic law and loyalty to the MSAR, made on October 16, 2021, at the inauguration ceremony as a deputy. Therefore, Lam considered ridiculous the possibility of being regarded as someone who does not support the basic law or defends the mandate: "The showcase on this side keeps the oath of the day I took the inauguration on October 16, 2021 as a deputy. Therefore, being now accused not to be faithful to masters is a great joke," he said. Ron Lam U Tou also revealed that, despite being excluded from the elections, he managed to get in and out of China without problems: “The day after the announcement of exclusion, I traveled to Hengqin. And yesterday (Tuesday) I returned from Shenzhen,” he said. During the podcast, Ron Lam was asked about the main regret while in AL. The deputy pointed to the absence of a crematorium, an installation that would contribute to the population to have a better and cheaper service. Lam lamented that there is a monopoly on cremation services, while Hong Kong can make funerals and cremations available at more human prices. Ron Lam also confessed that he will only think of his future after ceasing to be a deputy, which should happen on 16 October, when future deputies take office.

item.title: Galaxyart | Bruno Moinard's design works exhibited until December
item.description:
Known for creative design and unique furniture, Bruno Moinard is the highlight of the new patent exhibition in the Galaxyart Space, included in the program of “Art Macao: Macao International Art Biennial”. The show is presented as “an immersive trip to the visionary world” of Moinard
More than 300 original design and furniture works are patent in the new exhibition on Galaxyart, entitled “In Bruno Moard's mind”, which is available for public visits until December 31. Integrated in this year's edition of “Art Macao: International Art Biennial of Macao”, the show is born from a partnership between Galaxy Entertainment Group and the Cultural Institute (IC). According to a Galaxy statement about the initiative, the exhibition is an “immersive journey to the visionary world” of Bruno Moinard, described as the “internationally acclaimed creative pioneer”. Among the 300 works include “Sketches to Design Paintings and Manuscripts” and “Custom Design Concepts from his Moinard Betaille Interior Design Studio for the Employment Capella at Galaxy Macau, which will be inaugurated soon”. It is a "golden residence with suites that will redefine new personalized luxury patterns." Quoted by the same note, Bruno Moinard referred at the inauguration of his exhibition, which the show is “a modest but sincere attempt to invite the public to enter this invisible space, which is an allegory of my creative world, where various disciplines talk, such as painting, design, interiors architecture or set design”. "Together they tell a story, and a unique way of seeing the world," added the artist. 30 years of career Bruno Moinard is “known for combining the best traditions of French handicrafts with modern design”, having received the distinction of knight from the Legion of Honor in 2010. Exposing work in Macau also represents a form of celebration of its 30 years of career and 12 of the brand's constitution, “Bruno Moard Éditions”. "In Bruno Moarard's mind - a special exhibition at Art Macao 2025" thus reveals "Moinard's multifaceted deeds, as his own right artist and as a first -rate designer, offering visitors a unique view of his exclusive design philosophy." At the same time, the organization highlights itself, “the instinctive art behind some of the most iconic luxury properties and spaces in the world”, presenting “a diversity of contemporary paintings, photographs and multimedia works”. The focus is on “in the way Bruno Moard's work, either for the most prominent 'maison' [houses, or entrepreneurial] of the world, or in the context of daily luxury, irradia spontaneity and instinctive talent”. The Galaxyart space is on the first floor of Galaxy Prumenade, Galaxy Macao.

item.title: Thailand | Nine dead and 14 injured by Cambojan air strikes
item.description:
Cambojan air strikes killed nine people, including an eight -year -old, and wounded 14, the Thai army said yesterday, the day the conflict between the two countries intensified.
Nine people died and 14 were injured in Thailand following the Cambodian air strike offensive. According to the Thai army, one of the deadly victims was a 14 -year -old child. Thailand said it had launched air strikes against two military targets in Cambodia, while Cambodian soldiers fired several rockets against Thai territory. Six people were killed in attacks near a fuel supply post in Sisaket (Northeast), two in the province of Surin (Northeast) and one in the province of Ubon Ratchathani (Northeast). Thai authorities announced the full closure of all terrestrial border passages with Cambodia, after clashes between the two armies in various areas that separate these neighboring countries. The level of security in the border passages was high for the 4-the maximum-which constitutes a complete closure, said at a press conference the spokesman for the Thai center that monitors the situation on the border with Cambodia, Admiral Surasant KongSiri. "Given the current situation, it is necessary for Thailand to close the barriers on border passages to protect our sovereignty, territorial integrity and the safety of people in border areas," said the center of the Center, Maratee Nalita at the same time. Coveted land Since late June, Thailand has implemented access restrictions on all border posts over the more than 800 kilometers of border that shares with Cambodia, allowing entry only for humanitarian reasons, health or education. The total closure comes after yesterday's clashes between Thai and Cambodian armies in a border zone disputed, according to both sides, who mutually accuse themselves to start the conflict after weeks of tension. However, Cambodia Prime Minister Hun Manet yesterday requested an emergency meeting of the UN Security Council. "Considering the recent extremely serious aggressions of Thailand, which have severely threatened peace and stability in the region, I sincerely ask you to call an emergency meeting of the Security Council to end Thailand's aggression," Hun Manet wrote in a letter to Security Council President Asim Iftikhar Ahmad. The longstanding conflict between the two countries rekindled on May 28, after a confrontation between the two armies around an unrestricted border zone claimed by the two nations, which resulted in the death of a Cambodian soldier. The Thailand Embassy in Cambodia yesterday asked Thai citizens to abandon the neighboring country, after the confrontations and given the possibility of the attacks "continuing and spreading." Territorial tension has been usually approached diplomatically, although between 2008 and 2011, about 30 people died in military clashes between the two countries in a territory adjacent to the Hindu Temple of Preah Vihear.

item.title: Economy | Inflation accelerated to 0.25% in June
item.description: Inflation in Macao accelerated in June, in a month that also in the interior of China the consumer price index rose again, after four consecutive months of descents, was announced yesterday. The Consumer Price Index (IPC) rose 0.25 percent in June, in homologous terms, faster than the amount recorded in May (0.19 percent), and the highest value since January (0.57 percent), according to the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). According to official data, the acceleration of inflation is partly due to the cost of meals acquired outside the home, which rose 1.39 percent, and food, with the price of products such as bread and cookies increasing 2.11 percent. Expenditure on lace or apartment mortgages rose 0.93 and 0.52 percent, respectively, after Macau's monetary authority approved three interest rates in the last three months of 2024.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: GAO GU (1391-1460), a Ming Dynasty politician and calligraphy, wrote in 1447 a comment in a painting by priest Daoist Fang Congyi (1301-1392) who is in Metmuseum, entitled Enevoid Mountains in which, at one point, says: «The gates of the mountain house seem as falls as if there was no one there. This will be either a place elected by immortals, or some supreme view of the world of mortals. Admiring the mountainous chain, Gao extends doubt to his own representation, wrapped in clouds and fogs, where the mountains would be endowed with a lightness that would soon make them loose and fly. These heavy and light mountains at the same time were a threshold, a conducive place for meetings from the most unlikely to the most certain friendship. It was one of those less amazing but no less stunning meetings that was registered by painter Zhu Ling (C.1635-C.1680) in the backing vessel to the spring mountains, in the shape of a folding range (paint and color on paper, 18 x 50.5 cm, in the Kaikodo collection, Hawai). And that sometimes illustrated from Doistists on the border of credibility, such as Fei Changfang, possessing a baton that allowed him to travel unbelievable distances. Zhu Ling not only followed in his paintings the characteristic style of Huang Gongwang (1269-1354), the master author of the Fuchun mountain roll, with the accumulation of small separate traces cun, 'wrinkles', to describe the shapes of the mountains, such as his alternative name (zi) derives from his phrase. item.title: Dengue Fever | Authorities warn of the risk of imported cases
item.description:
Macau is facing a “high risk” period of imported cases of dengue fever and chikungunya. The warning was reiterated yesterday at a joint conference on health services and the institute for municipal affairs. Last year's dengue fever cases have been the highest of the last two decades
Health Services (SS) and the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) joined yesterday to alert the population to the growing risk of imported cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever, given that the summer period is synonymous with more travel and travel. At a press conference, Leong Iek Hou, doctor and head of the SS disease prevention and control center, said that "there was an increase in cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever in neighboring regions, which is a high risk to Macao." In addition, he added, "we know that we are in the summer time, there is an increase in the number of Macao residents who travel abroad, or tourists traveling to Macao, factors that may increase the risk of disease." Thus, “the risk of cases [fever] in Macau is high,” said the official. Leong Iek Hams advanced some numbers, having said that until Sunday, 2,285 confirmed fever cases were reported, 2,100 occurred only in Shunde district. In the case of Macao, between 2013 and 2019 there were “two to three imported cases of chikungunya fever, all from Southeast Asia”, but in recent years it has increased, although there are no serious cases. Leong Iek Hou also highlighted the fact that, last Friday, Macau registered the first imported case of this year's Chikungunya fever. According to a statement issued by the SS that same day, the patient is a 61 -year -old man, resident and resident in the Cheng I building, on Avenida do Conselheiro Borja. Between July 8 and 17, the patient moved to Shunde district in Foshan, with the aim of visiting family members. However, they describe the SS, on the morning of the 17th “began to present symptoms such as fever, headaches, muscle and joint aches, among others”, having returned Macao and sought medical treatment at the Conde de São Januário hospital center. On the 18th, the public health laboratory confirmed the presence of the Chikungunya virus, with a positive result. To date, the patient has kept stable. Since the beginning of the year and until July 19, the city of Foshan recorded a total of 1,873 confirmed cases of chikungunya fever, of which 1,790 are from Shunde district, focusing mainly on the villages of Lecong, Beijiao, Chenncun. 49 cases occurred in the district of Chancheng, focusing mainly on the sub-district of Shiwanzhen, Zumiao and Zhangcha; While 34 cases were detected in the Nanhai district, focusing mainly on the Guicheng sub-district. A dengue of the worst As for dengue fever cases, Leong Iek Hama pointed out that by 2024 the occurrence of this disease "it was relatively more severe when compared to the last 20 years, as 38 cases of dengue were recorded, nine locations." "This year were registered eight cases imported of dengue fever, being a place," said the SS official. It has been said that it is possible to lock and combat these infections through, for example, the cleaning of stagnant water, which attracts the proliferation of mosquitoes. “This year we have done more work to eliminate mosquitoes with Jardim Camões,” said Fong Vai Seng, head of the AMI Environmental Hygiene Department. "We can say that we can eliminate mosquitoes that can be carriers of the virus [causer of fevers], avoiding its transmission. In any of the forms we are at the peak of cases, and residents and tourists may be carried to the virus, so we have to be alert. We have done a series of cleaning work to avoid the source of mosquitoes proliferation, and until June [since the year] we have supervised about 7,400 spaces." It was mentioned. Inspection actions took place in 140 places that are considered “black points” with regard to the proliferation of mosquitoes, and between January and June this year, 1,220 chemical elimination actions of these insects were made. Both entities promise to work side by side in cleaning land. “AMI and SS have a mechanism for monitoring and treatment of hygiene problems in private spaces or unoccupied land. Whenever the ss find that there is danger to public health, or in case of an emergency situation, and whenever it is not possible to contact the landowners, AMI will collaborate on removing containers or zones with stagnant water that may serve as proliferation of Mosquitoes, ”was said at the press conference. Leong Iek Hou also explained that there are not yet many places in Macao where tests can be done that disapprove of the infection. "There are not many medical institutions that have this type of test available. When clinics or private hospitals want to take the test for dismissing transmissible diseases, these institutions send us blood samples and we do the tests in our public health laboratory for free for various types of fever, given that symptoms are similar." Hong Kong on Alert The risk alert of more imported cases of these two types of fever has also arrived in Hong Kong. According to the South China Morning Post newspaper on Thursday, several experts warn of the high risk of infections taking into account the outbreak registered in the city of Foshan, belonging to Guangdong province. Wong Hoi-Kei, a senior doctor and head of the Guangdong Center for Health Protection, said that "although outbreaks do not occur in popular cities among Hong Kong inhabitants, frequent trips between Guangdong and Hong Kong mean the risk of imported cases is higher." Also quoted by the same newspaper, doctor Joseph Tsang Kay-Yan, an infectious illness expert, said it is possible that Hong Kong will have imported cases that may lead to sporadic infections, and explained that the two types of fevers have similar symptoms, but with a big difference: with chikungunya fever, patients feel joint pain. Wong Hoi-Kei said that several cleaning actions are being developed to avoid proliferation of mosquitoes and to inform the population for symptoms. "We have the ability to reduce the risk of an outbreak triggered by imported cases as much as possible," Wong said. This year alone, and according to data released by SCMP, more than 220,000 cases of chikungunya fever were registered worldwide in 14 locations, including the Taiwan and Singapore regions. The latest cases of this type of fever in Hong Kong had occurred in 2019, with only 11 patients. According to the SS, the means of transmission and measures to prevent and control chikungunya fever and dengue fever are identical, both transmitted by mosquitoes of “aedes albopictus” species, which usually reproduce in small amounts of stagnant, clean and stopped water. Given the recent passage through Macao do Typhoon Wipha, the authorities yesterday remembered the importance of cleaning these spaces. Chikungunya fever is a viral disease and has a period of incubation of three to eight days, which can vary between two and 12 days, with fever symptoms and then joint pain in body areas such as wrists, knees, ankles and fingertips. Two to three days later rashes appear. "The whole course of the disease usually lasts five to seven days, being the state of health of most patients considered light," explains the SS.

item.title: War | Historians defend a monument about Vitória against Japanese invasion
item.description:
In a year of celebration of the 80th anniversary of China's victory in the war against Japanese aggression, Macao schools were encouraged by the government to convey these historical episodes to students. In the fervor of the ephemeris, an academic defended the construction of a monument to mark the date. HM has heard historians who enhance the ideas that should be transmitted by the monument
2025 is the year in which the 80th anniversary of China's victory is celebrated in the so -called Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and anti -fascist World War, that is, when China and Hong Kong managed to escape the Japanese occupation. Macao, having Portuguese administration, and for having kept neutral during World War II, was not occupied by the Japanese, although the neutrality status was quite volatile, as historian Helena Lopes showed in the work “Neutrality and Collaboration in South China: Macau During the Second World War”. In this context, the authorities have encouraged the territory schools to remember the historical episode through various activities with a patriotic nature, while Lin Guangzhi, director of the Institute for Social and Cultural Research of the University of Science and Technology of Macao (Must in the English), argued that a monument of war in Japan with Japan should be created in Macau. HM invited two historians, experts in this historical period, to comment on what has indeed happened in these years and what main messages should be transmitted if the construction of the monument actually advances. Alfredo Gomes Dias, professor of the Lisbon Polytechnic Institute and author of the Doctoral Thesis on Macaense Diaspora in World War II and the Foundation of the Popular Republic of China, entitled “The Macaense Diaspora. Macau, Hong Kong, Shanghai (1850-1952)”, argues that the celebration of this historical period is common to several countries. "In the case of China, the end of the Japanese invasion, taking into account the violence of which it has covered, can and should be celebrated generically throughout the Chinese territory," he said. But considering that Hong Kong had an effective occupation, while Macau dealt with refugee seizures and power games between Portuguese, Chinese, English and Japanese, will make sense to have a monument on the mashes? Alfredo Gomes Dias understands that yes. “In the case of Macao, the monument gains relief if he perpetuates the memory that Chinese, Portuguese and Macanese have fought the invasion, especially on the island of Hong Kong, many of them died on the battlefield. In addition, Macau maintained the tradition of being a territory of refuge that housed Chinese and Macanese from Hong Kong.” Essentially, the researcher understands that "in any of the cities he can be erected," but in the particular case of Macao, it is important that the monument "intends to take into account the specificity of the history of Macao and the diversity of origin of its residents." Moreover, which argues that it should "preserve the memory of all who have joined side by side to oppose Japanese imperialism at this time." “Ambiguous neutrality” For Helena Lopes, a particular interest historian in Macao's landscape in World War II, and author of the work on Macao's neutrality during this period, said she did not see "no problem in building a commemorative monument of World War II in Macao." In the 1930s and 40s of the twentieth century, he recalls, "most of the population was, like today, Chinese," although "a significant number of the population was a refugee, having sought in Macao (such as in other places not occupied in China) shelter of the violence of conflict." Thus, Helena Lopes, professor of history at contemporary Asia at the University of Cardiff, in Wales, says it is "normal for China to celebrate victory in World War II, as other allied countries do." Regarding Macao's neutrality, the historian says it was "ambiguous", given that "many opposite sides intersected in the territory during the war." In these years, "the territory has been deeply linked to networks of resistance and humanitarian aid during the war: it was not isolated from conflict, but it was deeply linked to several of its dynamics identically to other territories in China under foreign dominance (such as foreign concessions of Shanghai or Hong Kong until these territories were completely occupied)." In this context, he adds Helena Lopes, "it seems natural to celebrate resistance against Japan during the war, where they participated - openly or underground - several people in Macao (Chinese and other nationalities)," he said. THE ROLE OF HISTORICAL EDUCATION Territory schools have been "encouraged" by the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) to organize sessions for students and teachers to watch the ceremonies of the "80th anniversary of the Chinese people's victory in the war against Japan and world victory against fascism." According to a press conference organized to announce these initiatives, the celebrations of the 80th anniversary of victory against the Japanese start on September 3 in Beijing, and DSEDJ intends to organize various events in Macao. Asked about the inclusion of historical celebrations, with a patriotic nature, in local schools, Helena Lopes says “having no elements to comment on the educational situation in Macao currently”, recalling that in the years of World War II, “schools in Macau were themselves, refuge spaces and resistance to Japanese occupation of China”. In turn, Alfredo Gomes Dias stresses that “historical education is always an extension of the narrative of national history”, “a reality common to all countries” and not exclusive to Macao. The DSEDJ press conference for the presentation of commemorative events was attended by the secretary for social and culture affairs, Lam, which has the Pelouro da Education. The ruler said last June that the government's goal is to "promote the great spirit of the War of Resistance" and "inspire patriotic fervor." All activities will be subordinate to the theme: "Remember the story, stroking the memory of the martyrs, caressing peace and creating the future." One of the highlights of the celebrations will be the memory of the victims of the Nanjing massacre, a celebration scheduled for December 13. Nanjing's massacre took place in 1937, having stepped for a few weeks after the conquest by the Japanese troops of the one who was the capital of the Republic of China. After the conquest, the Japanese troops massacred the population, including children, women and not combatants. The invasion of China through Japan began in 1931 with the occupation of Manchuria at first. In 1937, Japan expanded the scope of war, seeking the total occupation of China. What began as a conflict located in Asia would eventually be integrated in World War II, from December 1941, with the attacks of Pearl Harbor. Over the course of several years, estimates point out that on the Chinese side between 3.8 million and 10.6 million people died. Peace was reached on December 2, after the United States attacked Japan with the second atomic bomb in Nagasaki. HM sent questions to Lin Guangzhi, author of the idea of building a monument, but until the closing of this edition was not obtained.

item.title: Wipha | Macau reached the maximum signal 10 and only lowered to 3 at night

Typhoon Wipha passed yesterday by Macau without leaving havoc of larger, although he has obliged the authorities of the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) to keep the 10th of storm, the maximum in this type of occurrences, for many hours, between 12:30 and 17h, when it was passed to signal 8. Sign 3 was really lifted at 10:30 pm on Sunday. At 20h was still the blue sign of “Storm Surge”, with expectations of flooding in the low areas of the city between 4am and 8am this Monday. According to official data, until 7 pm on Sunday the Civil Protection Operations Center recorded 163 occurrences on both the Macao Peninsula and the islands, especially the registration of five typical injuries, which received hospital treatment in both public health facilities and the Kiang Wu Hospital. Only one person will have been retained in the elevator during the passage of the tropical storm. It is also mentioned the registration of 54 cases in which authorities had to remove broken lamps, falling trees or overthrowing, or construction infrastructure with potential risk. The response of Lam Hin San, director of services for traffic affairs, granted on August 8, 2023, was comprehensive against the deputy's questions: “When the sign of Tropical Storm No. 8 or of higher degree is a sign, the government will adopt, under the law, restrictive precautionary measures, and the residents and tourists remain at home or in safe places”.

item.title: Macao Forum | Former advisor to Rocha Vieira enhances complementarity
item.description:
The role of the Macao Forum should be compromised in a complementary way to other existing cooperation. The idea was defended by Tiago Vasconcelos, advisor to Rocha Vieira, at a symposium promoted by the City of Macau. The Major General also agrees with the extent of the forum to Spanish-speaking countries
On Tuesday at the City of Macau (UCM), a symposium centered on cooperation in areas of scientific research and higher education between Macau, China and Portuguese-speaking countries, which served to present various academic projects that are being developed at MSAR. The event was attended by Major General Tiago Vasconcelos, who was the advisor to General Rocha Vieira in the last years of the Portuguese administration of the territory, and defended a broader look at the role that the Macao Forum can take. In its presentation, which HM had access, it is read that "the importance of the creation of the Macao Forum cannot be underestimated, both symbolic and practical," but "one must be realistic about what one can expect from such an organization." Thus, for Tiago Vasconcelos, “the Macao Forum must find its place among other forms of diplomacy”, such as “bilateral relations, in some cases 'strategic partnerships' bilateral, such as Brazil and Portugal”, or “belonging to other forums” or “multilateral organizations such as G20 or BRICS, of which both China and Brazil are members, or the ASEAN Regional Forum, of which Timor-Leste as China are participants. ” It is for the person responsible for a "variable geometry", where "the belongings of countries to various forums simultaneously can offer opportunities for the" Macao Platform "to broaden its scope." And here the former advisor of the last Portuguese governor of Macau highlights the importance of the extent of the MSA platform to Spanish -speaking countries, something that has also been defended by the local executive. Thus, the MSAR can, with the multiplicity of roles and partnerships of the Macao Forum, “reach other Latin-speaking countries, especially Spanish-speaking, given the similarities between Portuguese and Spanish languages, and existing dialogue platforms, such as the Ibero-American conference, which connects Portugal, Spain and most Latin American countries”. In general terms, the official understands that one should “understand the proper role played by the Macau Forum among the various personalized bilateral and multilateral cooperation formats, as well as the lessons learned from the more than 20 years of history of the Forum”. This “is of paramount importance to ensure the proper level of ambition and the effectiveness of any new forms of cooperation in which Macau can act as a useful platform,” he said. A promising land In conclusion, Tiago Vasconcelos said that since the arrival of the early Portuguese to the territory, in the mid -16th century, that "Macau has played a traditional role as a platform between mainland China and the outside world", playing "part of the" Portuguese world "for almost 450 years, naturally integrating its network." Thus, ties with Portuguese -speaking countries are "a legacy of their history," which "helps Macao to preserve some of their distinctive characteristics, but also play a useful role in supporting Chinese diplomacy, further facilitating China's relations with Portuguese -speaking countries." For Tiago Vasconcelos, “Macau's prospects are quite promising to continue to play its traditional and very distinctive role as a connecting platform between China and the Portuguese-speaking countries”, taking into account that it begins half of the 50-year transition period present in the Sino-Portuguese joint statement of 1987. Still in the area of higher education, the Major General pointed out that "despite its dimension, Macau is becoming, if it is no longer, a center of excellence for higher education in China." "Even worldwide, the same can be said about some specific sectors, making Macau a highly attractive destination for very talented students," he added. The official highlighted the role of the four key laboratories of the existing state, namely VLSI (large-scale integrated circuits) analog and mixed signal at the University of Macao (one); The Quality Research Laboratory in Chinese Medicine, between one and the University of Science and Technology of Macao; The Internet of Things Laboratory to Smart Cities, at UM; and also the laboratory for the Lunar and Planetary sciences, of Must. The seminar where Tiago Vasconcelos participated, entitled “Scientific and Technological Cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries”, also attended representatives of the central government's connection office on the Macau forum, among other academic and business personalities. According to a press release on the event sent to HM, José Paulo Esperança, vice-rector of the UCM Faculty of Economics, spoke of the importance of financing academic investigations by the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) in Portugal, highlighting “FCT's efforts to promote international cooperation and resolution of common challenges”. IP KUAI PENG, Vice-Rector of UCM and Director of the Institute of Studies of Portuguese Speaking Countries of the same educational institution, argued that Macau “should be based on cooperation with Portuguese-speaking countries”, as well as “actively expanding exchange in various areas with Spanish-speaking countries, building a deep, and sustainable cooperation ecosystem, continuing to expand the circle of international friends and international friends and draw a new plan for modernization ”in the format followed by China. In addition, the official believes that the “remains an important high-level outside opening window for the country” should continue to create “an international cooperation model in areas such as high technology, digital economy and standardization of traditional Chinese medicine, contributing to the construction of a technological power of the country and, at the same time, achieving diverse and moderate economic development”. Think-Tank to Spanish The UCM Vice Rector believes it can be created in Macau “an interregional Think Tank with the best universities in Portuguese and Spanish countries, focusing on areas such as green energy, biomedicine and digital technology, promoting transionic circulation with technological means and helping developing countries to overcome digital gap”. Among the participating researchers in the seminar, highlighting Marta Filipa Simões, from the Macao University of Science and Technology, which presented the Sino-Portuguese Cooperation Project in Fungi and Astrobiology Research. The academic suggested “the conduct of various research projects through cooperation between Macau and scientific research institutions in Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Mozambique and Portugal, in order to promote interregional scientific innovation”. Already André Antunes, from the University of São José, stressed that, currently, "Macao plays an important role as a point of contact in the network of Portuguese-speaking countries", with a very centered cooperation "in the economic area", although, he defended, "the scientific area will become in a new strong point."

item.title: Sao Tome and Prince | Relationship with China is discreet, but strategic
item.description:
On Saturday, 50 years of the independence of Sao Tome and Principe were celebrated. The future advances to the rhythm of diplomatic relations with other Portuguese speaking countries. For academic Cátia Miriam Costa, the African country and China are strategic partners, despite the description of the relationship between both
Researcher Cátia Miriam Costa considers that the relationship between Sao Tome and Principe and China remains discreet, despite being almost celebrating a decade, with a growing strategic interest of Beijing in the position of the archipelago in the South Atlantic. "Since neither country nor another talks much about the subject, we end up not realizing the depth of the relationship well. But I believe it is not yet a very deep relationship," the researcher at the Center for International Studies of ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, noted to Lusa. The geostrategic position of the archipelago, located in the Gulf of Guinea, feeds, however, the interest of Beijing, namely in the context of the Chinese bet on the expansion of logistics and sea corridors in the South Atlantic. "Sao Tome, if it is not a very important port in logistical terms, is a relevant port for control, for example, of piracy, threats. Therefore, this position also certainly reflected by Beijing," he explained. The restoration of formal ties in 2016, after two decades of Taiwan's recognition by Sao Tome, was a “pragmatic” decision of the African country, and a trump card for Beijing Diplomacy, which always maintained “open channels”, even during the period of removal, Cátia Miriam Costa explained. "The relationship with China is more fruitful because it brings other counterparts," explained the researcher. "It was also for these counterparts that [in 1997] Sao Tome exchanged the Popular Republic of China for Taiwan, because at that time the Popular Republic of China was a developing country. So it didn't have to offer what Taiwan had, which was perfectly integrated into the international market," he said. A VOLTE-FACE In December 2016, Sao Tome officially announced the establishment of relations with the Popular Republic of China, ending the recognition of Taiwan. The decision caused the immediate cancellation of the scholarships offered by Taiwan to St.-Tome students, many of whom were eventually integrated into the other Chinese universities. China has quickly become one of the main cooperation partners in São Tomé, with promises of investment and support in areas such as education, technical training, agriculture and infrastructure. The researcher recalled that even before formal relations, Beijing never completely broke with Sao Tome, keeping the country involved in the activities of the Macao Forum, albeit only as an observer, a strategy he considers "typical of Chinese diplomacy." "China does not fully close the doors. It can suspend relationships, but if it is something of national interest, it is usually renegotiated again," he said. “Limited Results” Nevertheless, Cátia Miriam Costa acknowledged that the concrete results of cooperation are still limited. “There are more projects in the role than properly ongoing works,” he said, attributing part of the responsibility to the weak institutional capacity of São Tomé, which only recently began to create structures to attract and negotiate foreign investment. Among the sectors with the potential for the deepening of cooperation, the researcher highlighted the fishing, the marine resources and eventually the cocoa. Oil exploration raises “high risks”, both for technical complexity and environmental limitations. "China is interested in the region, but it is not because Sao Tome is an attractive market -because it is not -, yes, for its location, stability and integration capacity in a broader regional project," he said. The researcher also stressed Chinese investment in Chinese language teaching in Sao Tome, which also aims to "create a network of people with language dominance, familiar with culture and potentially useful for the future of bilateral relations." "China maintains a strategic interest in the relationship, even if it does not express it with great visibility. And for a country like Sao Tome, any small help can have a significant impact," he concluded. Denise Aragão Fortes still remembers her hand to Tsai Ing-Wen. It was November 2016, the day of Africa in Taiwan was celebrated, and the official was attended at the time. item.title: Coloane | Government canceled project of the Museum of Paladers 9 years ago
item.description:

However, years later, the direction of tourism services says that the project will not even move forward, having been suspended in 2016
Between 2016 and 2017, the government planned to raise a museum about Coloane's stalps to tell the story of these peculiar houses of Macao. However, after news was published in the press to convey the inauguration of the project in 2017, the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD) confirmed to HM that no museum will be born. More: Not only will it not be built, but the plan was aborted nine years ago. “Due to the inclusion of the area where stilts are located in the government's urban planning plan for the coloane riverside, Lai Chi Vun shipyards and Navegantes Street, STD ended the 'Museum of the Museum of the Museum of the House' in 2016, and, subsequently, completed the 'Museum of House Project' procedure. Canceled ”, was referred to in the answer. The cancellation in 2016 is still surprising, given that on June 14 of the same year the Jornal Tribuna de Macao (JTM) reported that the inauguration of the museum would take place in 2017. In this article, statements were cited by the director of STD, Helena de Senna Fernandes, made to the newspaper or Mun, explaining that the “project was in the [conception] phase of design”. They would have been held, including “several consultations to collect opinions from the residents of that area, expecting to improve the proposal of construction”. According to JTM, the project should “be completed by the end of the year” in 2016, so that the work will be “started early 2017”, and STD expected “that the construction was completed in the same year”. After the promise, in 2018 there was still “legal fundamentals” to build the Museum in Coloane, as also reported the JTM. The justification given by the STD was that Macau has not yet had the 85 square kilometers of maritime areas under his jurisdiction, something that has been legislated, precisely, since 2018. A matter of priorities HM sought to know the state of the designer of the Museum of Palafites following the recent launch of a book on the collage of Colaane, by Filipe Afonso, coordinator of the degree in Architecture of the University of São José. Now confronted with the official cancellation of the museum project, the official lamented the decision of the authorities. "The cancellation of the Museum of Slacinas project is not just news about a project that has not advanced, but a starting point to equate Macao's development priorities, the way the heritage is managed and what means for collective memory, in this case of Coloane," he said. In the opinion of the author of “The Colaane Grammar”, “The Plan for the Marginal of Rua dos Navegantes should include proposals for new buildings that use and reinterpret Madeira as the main and essential element of construction”, and the connection of this street with the Lai Chi Vun shipyards, “especially with regard to the sea front, is a unique opportunity to create a coastal corridor that celebrates Colona's seafront history”. Still on the patrimonial value, Filipe Afonso described, in the interview with HM, the proposal to “classify stilts as heritage to give them legal protection”. "By cataloging existing stilts, the book contributes to preserving the memory of this type of architecture and a broader discussion about its possible protection," he argued, adding that dwellings, many of them left to abandonment, "could be reused for experience tourism, or cultural interpretation centers, valuing local history." They could also “be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the waterline, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification”. Hopes Filipe Afonso highlights the process of revitalization and recovery of the Lai Chi Vun shipyard zone as a “initiative with immense historical and cultural value, which refers to the rich tradition of the region's shipbuilding”. In fact, the Lai Chi Vun shipyard zone is one of the “six zones” to recover by the government and operators, which also include places such as the pier in the interior port or Avenida Almeida Ribeiro, among others. In the area of Lai Chi Vun there is already a leisure zone where cultural initiatives have been carried out, with a museum area that tells the history of the Junos construction industry in the territory. In this sense, Filipe Afonso asks that “the Macao government does not limit the design of these projects to a restricted range of‘ short-listed companions ””, ie a restricted group of companies. Also, in his opinion, "Macau has a new generation of talented architects and creative ready to make his contribution." Deleting them from such crucial processes for Macao's urban and cultural development is a waste," he added. The HM contacted other architects to get reactions to the cancellation of the museum project, but did not get answers. What the law says Between the suspension of the project and today a lot has changed. In 2018, Macao arranged from the maritime management bases law, which includes 85 square kilometers of area, and whose principles provides for the environmental preservation of spaces such as those that stilts are inserted. The legislation introduced concepts such as “functional maritime zoning”, in the sense of delimiting zones “with fundamental and specific maritime functions according to location, natural resources, environmental conditions and exploration and use needs”. In the list of principles to be complied with, the legislation speaks of something like “protection of the environment of maritime areas”, in order to “protect natural resources and the environment of the sea, realizing the planning of protection and promotion of the marine ecosystem, and the marine protection should be taken into account”. It should also be “conserving the sustainability of use and development” of these areas, and their use should be done “scientifically”, according to functional maritime zoning ”. In addition to the concrete legislation that tied the paddle museum in 2016, there was also a direct planning plan to MSAR, something that was implemented in 2022 and also brings new directives for the exploration of maritime zones. Coloane now has its own UOPG-Operative Planning and Management Unit, where a “rational organization of public infrastructures and collective use equipment” should apply, as well as “appropriate use of soils” in order to create a “coordinated space structure”. Coloane's UOPG is part of the “ecological conservation zone”, which aims to “protect areas with ecological value” and “contribute to the greater protection of natural resources with ecological value”. Here it will not be allowed “to allocate soils for housing, commercial, industrial, tourist and amusement uses”, reads in the director of the masket. Coloane's UOPG is also integrated into the “green or open public spaces”, and here should be “maintaining the current use for green spaces and outdoor activities, integrating it [Coloane's UOPG] into the green zone or open public spaces”. Specifically, Coloane's UOPG should “promote the development of ecotourism and cultural tourism, with the creation of a tours of nature and the 'green and resilient waist', based on the combination of natural resources, namely hills, sea and coastal lines”. It should also “conserve and optimize existing industrial zones, build the 'waist of knowledge - industry - science' and the 'waist of cooperation of a river, two margins' and, simultaneously, rationally plan the housing zones in adequate location, according to the principle of balance between professional and residential functions”, and these points interconnect with the paradise zone, Navigantes Street and Savings Lai chi vun. item.title: AL | New Regiment prohibits deputies from disseminating content of the commissions
item.description:
With the new Hemiciclo Regiment approved yesterday, the deputies are prohibited from publicizing the subjects discussed in the meetings of the permanent committees, except for their presidents and secretaries. The subject generated debate yesterday in the Assembly regarding the limits of what may or may not be said. Pereira Coutinho voted against this article
The deputies of the Legislative Assembly (AL) are now prohibited from disseminating what is discussed at the Hemiciclo Commission meetings, "anyway," with the exception of its president and secretary. These usually disclose the content of the meetings at a press conference after their holding, and this will keep up. This new regulation arises after the vote and discussion, in general and specialty, the alteration to the al. It was one of the most discussed topics in yesterday's debate, with the deputies arguing on what can or can not be said, having José Pereira Coutinho voted against this concrete article. The disclosure of information from the meetings, which serves to analyze in the specialty proposals of law and always steering at the closed door, was something that was not yet regulated. Coutinho began by asking if he could disclose the information "during the plenary meeting", for example, having said that "he never heard of any deputy who had violated that duty." "There have been meetings in the past where the secretaries warned about the information that should not be disclosed and nothing has been said. We are only 33 deputies and we should think of the possibility of revealing what was discussed, because it is difficult to define borders about what can or can not be revealed and this will give rise to many discussions later," he said. The legislator also pointed out that "it can be difficult to execute this norm" and that "the principle of transparency" should be followed. Ho Ion Sang, who presided over to the commission that analyzed the new Al Regiment, explained that "the content of the meetings is subject to the duty of confidentiality and this matter was clarified." "The content can be said by the president of the commissions after the meetings, at the press conferences, and journalists can ask questions. In practice remains as always happened and that has given good results," he said. Meet the meetings Another point addressed, whether or not the permanent committees were held at the closed door, and Pereira Coutinho defended the opening to the public like what happens in Hong Kong. The AL regiment does not prohibit open meetings, but this always depends on a prior deliberation. But iau Teng Pio, deputy, advised against the opening of the meetings. "The purpose of the closed -door meetings is so that members of the government, advisors and deputies can argue at ease even if there is no final decision. Kou Hoi In, president of AL, recalled that “the spirit of the norm has not been changed” and that everything will stay in it, only the ban on what deputies cannot refer outside the commissions. "The reserved character of permanent commissions is so that everyone can speak freely and if any deputy says this or that can spoil sensations of injustice in society to deputies and this cannot happen. We have to protect deputies and ensure confidentiality." At yesterday's meeting, there was also the discussion of the duty of the deputy to participate in all permanent committees, even in those to which he does not belong. Several deputies spoke of the need for better coordination of meetings agendas. "In the future there may be more practical coordination because there are many meetings and proposals of law. We can schedule the meetings so that there are more deputies," he said. Moreover, the new Al regiment prohibits deputies by "clothing or signs, banners, signs or other objects that have offensive content or political provocation, or undermine the dignity of the AL".

item.title: Real Estate | Chan Iek Lap calls for seal tax reduction
item.description:
The deputy thinks that the government must follow the examples of Hong Kong and the interior of China and reduce the value of the seal tax on home purchase. Moreover, it argues that the tax should not be paid when the business is aborted
Deputy Chan Iek Lap advocates the reduction of the seal tax on real estate transactions. The subject is addressed through written interpeação, released on the Legislative Assembly portal. In the document, the deputy asks if there is an opening of the executive to lower the value of the tax seal on real estate transactions, as indicated in Hong Kong and in the interior of China: “Given the tendency to change taxes on real estate transactions in neighboring regions, and since the cities in the interior of China and also Hong Kong also indicated that the future goes through tax adjustments to reduce the charges on transactions. Will real estate agents, will the government consider the possibility of reducing tax costs for the benefit of the public? ”Asks the legislator. Currently, the seal tax on costly real estate transmissions ranges from 1 percent in transmissions with a value up to 2 million patacas, rises to 2 percent when the value of the business exceeds 2 million patacas and reaches 4 million patacas. The highest tax is 3 percent, when the value of the transfer of the property exceeds 4 million patacas. If the transmission has no costs for the parties, the tax is 5 percent. In the same vein, Chan wants to know if the executive has plans to reduce bureaucratic costs associated with real estate transactions. Since the COVID-19 pandemic and the campaign against the prosecutors of the game that the local real estate market has gone into crisis, with successive breaks of real estate and the reduction of transactions. The situation finds parallel in the interior, where the real estate market also suffered a sharp decrease. As a way of reaction to the real estate crisis, the government of Ho IAT SENG launched in 2024 a package of measures that aimed to lower taxation that focuses on residents and non-residents. Voluntary interruption In questioning, Chan Iek Lap argues that the executive must change the seal tax collection regime in cases where real estate transactions are aborted. Currently, real estate purchase and sale contracts are subject to tax payment, even if there is no transmission of the property's property right, because the parties choose to give up the business. There are also situations where the tax is paid, even later the parties have conditions that make it impossible to transmit the property. For Chan Iek Lap the tax payment in these situations is “extremely irrational”. Even in cases where it is possible to recover the amount of paid amount, when there was no transmission of the property, the deputy complains that it is necessary to face a case in the courts, and pay the costs that the action implies. In view of this scenario, the deputy intends that the government alter the legislation so that the tax is only due when the parties effectively transmit the property. At the same time, it asks for the return to the past, when 0.5 percent of the tax was paid at the time of the transaction and the rest at the time of signature of the Notarial Certificate of Purchase and Selling.

item.title: AL | Ron Lam worried about lack of various voices
item.description:
Still dealing with the impact of exclusion from elections, Deputy Ron Lam considers that at this stage the most important thing is to ensure that among the future 14 deputies directly elected someone represents the opinions of the population in the hemiciclo
At a time when he is still a deputy, although prevented from participating in the next elections by political decision of the State Security Defense Commission, Ron Lam was concerned with lack of voices in the Legislative Assembly (AL) representing the population. The position was taken during the latest episode of the Macao Synergy Association podcast, which served as a base of support for the deputy's list. According to Lam, with its departure there is a risk of all voices within the hemiciclo if they always limit the government, without questioning the projects presented. The legislator fears as soon as deputies, due to the fear of questioning, merely agree with almost everything the government presents and do not contribute to the development of the territory, nor to take action that meet the wishes of the population. Ron Lam justified a new environment in the Legislative Assembly, due to the way he was viewed by the system as a radical, when he was previously seen as a moderate. "Looking at my speeches and comparing the past, people said they were soft and in vain. But now they say they are radical," Lam said. "But to be honest, if even these criticisms are accepted, I wouldn't be able to continue to work either," he added. The deputy then focused on his replacement: "Now the most important question is to see who will be with the place of Ron Lam u tou in the Legislative Assembly. Even though Ron Lam u tou macau synergy association are represented, this is not the most important. The important thing is that some of the six lists and the 14 elected deputies play the same role," he said. Almost everything in favor Throughout the podcast, Ron Lam did not escape the process of his exclusion, which he once again said he could not understand. Despite the criticism and doubts raised in the Plenary of AL, the still deputy said he voted for almost 95 percent of occasions in favor of the government. And when he voted against, Ron Lam justified that the proposals had very evident problems, or that the government did not want to explain the reasons for legislative options, as it said that it had happened in the vote of the new intermediate housing law and the law of the game forcing the end of satellite casinos. Ron Lam also recalled that although his criticism was aimed at some rulers, as he was the only one who dared to question, that some of his views were adopted and resulted in savings for the public purse: "I remember once, one ruler told me," Only you have problems, the other deputies do not have. " “Also on a more important and recent subject, as with housing buildings for specialist doctors, I was the only one against the project. At that time our list was accused of being the opposition. Now the government has abandoned the project and managed to save 500 million patacas, ”he added. Output Ron Lam also showed in a showcase and proudly the oath of defense of the basic law and loyalty to the MSAR, made on October 16, 2021, at the inauguration ceremony as a deputy. Therefore, Lam considered ridiculous the possibility of being regarded as someone who does not support the basic law or defends the mandate: "The showcase on this side keeps the oath of the day I took the inauguration on October 16, 2021 as a deputy. Therefore, being now accused not to be faithful to masters is a great joke," he said. Ron Lam U Tou also revealed that, despite being excluded from the elections, he managed to get in and out of China without problems: “The day after the announcement of exclusion, I traveled to Hengqin. And yesterday (Tuesday) I returned from Shenzhen,” he said. During the podcast, Ron Lam was asked about the main regret while in AL. The deputy pointed to the absence of a crematorium, an installation that would contribute to the population to have a better and cheaper service. Lam lamented that there is a monopoly on cremation services, while Hong Kong can make funerals and cremations available at more human prices. Ron Lam also confessed that he will only think of his future after ceasing to be a deputy, which should happen on 16 October, when future deputies take office.

item.title: Female
item.description:
Recently, news that circulated online, reported that the “mutual help society to the co-babling of women” in the UK, headquartered in London, had received more than 50 women all in their 50s. Mutual aid society only receives women who are alone. It is an exclusive space reserved only for women, where men have no place. The goal is to provide these women a space where they can live independently, to help each other and live with dignity and autonomy, in a more advanced phase of life. These exclusive spaces are apartments that can have one, two or three bedrooms, properties of the mutual help society. The highest price of a 3 bedroom apartment is £ 400,000, about $ 4.2 million from Hong Kong (HKD). Women can buy them according to their financial abilities. Mutual care include financial management and domestic group maintenance, etc. Women can participate in different groups depending on their interests and their skills that put the service of collective life. For example, the group may be in charge of hiring staff to deliver meals to sick women and take care of those who are no longer self-sufficient. If group members are unable to perform these tasks on their own they can ask for help from other residents. A lady who lives in the mutual help society said that this model gave him the courage to face aging. The reason for the emergence of mutual aid societies for the co-babling of women is that they stop working earlier to take care of their children and family and their economic condition and the social circle are more limited. But even more significant is the greatest female longevity. If you live alone at an advanced age, your situation deserves more attention. Guardian announced that since 1997, 1 in 6 British has been over 65 years old. From 2017, this percentage increased to 1 in 5 and it is estimated that in 2037, out of 4 British 1 will be over 65 years old. This trend reflects the aging of the British population. In Japan, more than 76,000 people living alone die at home unaccompanied and more than 21,000 are only discovered 8 days after death. Therefore, a place where a group of older people live together can avoid loneliness and the possibility of dying alone. In the society of our day, there is a tendency to live alone. One of the attractions of this situation is the decrease in the financial burden. Those who live in a family have more expenses and still have to take care of their parents. Singles have a more reliable life. As mentioned above, the price of a three -bedroom mutual help society apartment around 4.2 million HKD, which can represent an affordable amount. Another advantage of being single is the freedom that you enjoy. Of course this freedom implies abdicating a family life, the possibility of having romantic relationships and children. The traditional Chinese concept of “raising children to ensure old age and storing grain to avoid hunger” (養兒防老 ， 積穀防飢) cannot be applied to singles. Should we choose to be single or should we organize a family life with children? There is no single answer to this question. It depends on how individuals weigh the pros and cons of various aspects of their preferences before making a decision. In either case, we should think carefully before opting. Despite everything, this decision will affect our whole life. If after 40, a woman wants to suddenly found a family and being a mother may have difficulty reaching this goal. When a person reaches the initial phase of aging, he can still move freely and have full use of his mental abilities, so living in a mutual aid society does not represent any problem. As age advances, physical condition is gradually deteriorated, intellectual abilities begin to slow down and diseases reduce mobility and communication capacity. For example, the elderly with Alzheimer's need to have professional care. Are these professionals present in mutual help societies to solve these problems? There is no detailed information on the subject. However, to ensure appropriate care for the elderly is more appropriate than being provided by professionals. For mutual aid societies to work in full, they must pay close attention to this subject. Should we, as a society, foster the appearance of more mutual help societies to widen these services to more people? To answer the question, we must try to understand social needs and carefully analyze whether there is any overlap in the roles of mutual aid societies and the elderly service agencies. A decision that can only be made after further research.

item.title: Counterfeit | Authorities make Rusga in store
item.description: Authorities performed a Rusga at a store on Horta e Costa Avenue on Wednesday, which led to the seizure of 155 pieces of clothing and counter-suitables. According to the official information, cited by the newspaper or Mun, the operation fell within the Canton-Hong Kong-Macau Hong of Industrial Property cooperation mechanism. If they were sold at the price of the products they mimicked, the pieces of clothing and the bags would be valued at 2.39 million patacas. According to customs services, at this stage authorities are still trying to investigate the identity of product suppliers as well as the store owner on Avenida Horta e Costa. The sale of products in question is an infringement of the legal regime of industrial property. For infrastors in these cases a punishment is expected to reach six months in prison or a penalty of fine from 30 to 90 days. According to the newspaper or Mun, in the presentation of the results of the Rusga, customs services have insisted that they will not save efforts to “proactively combat infringements to the legal regime of intellectual property”.
